headline: The Best Banana Bread
description: This is the best banana bread recipe. Purists will delight in this quick bread, flavored only with mashed banana. Easy to make with simple variations.

video.description: Here’s a versatile banana bread for banana bread purists.
video.name: The Best Banana Bread

name: The Best Banana Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
Beat sugar and margarine in a bowl until smooth. Beat in eggs, then bananas. Add flour and baking soda, stirring just until combined. Pour into the prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick in the center comes out clean, about 1 hour. Remove from the pan and let cool.
Store in the refrigerator or freeze.

review.reviewBody: My family loves this recipe. I add extra bananas!! Yummy!!!

I used butter in place of margarine. Added a half cup of dark brown sugar. More banana doesn't hurt the bread at all. Added tsp. vanilla, sometimes a Tbs of spiced rum. sprinkle nuts on top before baking. Delish bread recipe!

This is the recipe my Mom used starting before 1948 when my sister was born. It is critical to let the batter rest for 15 minutes. That's how it comes out high. So many people make it goopy and I don't like it. It's especially good fresh out of the oven and cooled just until warm.

I made this in a bundt pan & I added a lil more banana, more like 2 cups. Omg it tastes sooo good. A perfect crust & a moist delectable interior. My whole house smells like bananas lol. Absolutely delicious.
I loved this recipe I even added a layer of banana slices in the middle to keep it moist and add an extra boost of flavor.
I used butter instead of margarine and added walnuts but the result came out a bit on the dry side with not much banana taste.

Super easy recipe to follow. The cake came out delicious and I got high marks from loved ones. The only reason I rated it 4 stars instead of 5 was because some baked goods aren’t complete without adding the beautiful combo of vanilla essence, fresh grated nutmeg and ground cinnamon powder - I think that’s what makes it the best, better than all the shop bought stuff. So, while I followed the how-to of the recipe I knew I had to add the extra flavour, which the recipe did not consider.

After reading a few of the reviews, I knew I had to try it. So, I bought some bananas and made sure they were extra ripe. I also made sure to follow the exact recipe and instructions. I made sure to do EVERYTHING the recipe said because if you’re telling me that this is the “Best Banana Bread,” I’ll ever have the pleasure of eating. It better be all that and then some, LOL. BTW, the recipe was super easy to follow, and it’s probably one of the easiest recipes I've tried in a long time. So thumbs up for that! Now, onto the real tea. Let’s get into this recipe. I gotta say…..I wouldn't say it's “The Best,” but it's definitely not the worst. I may even try it again…I'm still on the fence. BUT if I do I’ll need to add a little more flavor. Some cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla extract. You get the idea. Overall I’ll give this recipe a 4 out of 5 stars.

This is such an easy and delicious recipe! I had 3 very overripe bananas that I needed to use and the rest of the ingredients are pantry staples I always have. I added the 1/2 cup chocolate chips as the video suggested, but I also added 1/2 tsp salt and 1/2 cup chopped pecans. The outcome was a tender cake with a crunchy top. I really like to eat it warm, slathered in butter.
We added a finely diced apple and a tsp of cinnamon and vanilla for more flavor! Perfect for late summer baking!
Add a little cinnamon maybe a touch of vanilla.

I just made this recipe again. It is my go to banana bread recipe.. I like an honest, pure banana bread and this fits the bill. The only change I made was adding 1 tsp of vanilla to the wet ingredients and 1/2 tsp of salt to the dry. Perfection
Easy, quick, very nice. I add a bit of salt, and caramel/ chocolate with nuts on the top. Amazing
Straight from the oven, the smell is great can't wait to taste it !

I loved the simple list of ingredients but added only 1, about ¼ cup of chopped walnuts, this time. The bread is delicious, moist with a "crispy" crust from the sugar. Saved this to definitely make it again & share with my family ❤️
OMG … it is the best one so far I’ve made. Family LOVED it!
The recipe is pretty straight forward and the loaf comes out tasty. I added nuts to give it some texture.
Easy and good! I added a tsp of vanilla to bring out the flavor of bananas.
I loved the softness and how well it taste without buttermilk.
I've made this many times now. Super simple recipe very easy to make. Not "bursting" with banana flavor but that might just be the bananas I used not being ripe enough?

I used 1 1/2 cups of flour and 1/2 cup of Malt-O-Meal which is the same as Cream of Wheat. I also ran out of bananas. I thought I had 3 but only had 2. My mashed bananas equalled 1 cup so I mashed up 1/2 cup of canned peaches (2 snack cups). I was also a tad short of margarine and made up the difference (about 1/8 cup) of apple sauce. I threw in 1/2 teaspoon of baking spice and another 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon plus 1 teaspoon of vanilla. I baked the bread on the lowest rack for one hour. Well, I thought this bread was going to be a disaster. It turned out perfectly. It is moist and dense. The banana and peaches really compliment each other. Great recipe. I can't believe how so many substitutions can result in such a wonderful bread.
Aloha. Such Great Easy Recipe. I Added Toasted Chopped Walnuts And Cinnamon. Mahalo For Sharing This Recipe 🤙🏾💜

This was good, but it needed salt! I kinda thought the ingredient list was too short, so I added a teaspoon of cinnamon to a double batch, and used half brown sugar, and half white. I didn’t think about the salt until my first bite. Nice texture, but Bland…
It was a God-send, simple, yet amazing. I used light agave and organic coconut sugar. I added chopped walnuts, and a hint of cinnamon. Thank you??
Love cup recipe's and easy to make. I always add chia seeds and walnut's. I don't always use eggs or butter and mix it up abit using olive oil when we have the vegetarians over
Delicious, basic banana bread. Browns up nicely, has a good ear. My go to!
Great! Versatile! Easy peasy!

Very easy and foolproof recipe overall. For added moistness, I add a bit more banana (about 2 cups) and a little extra vanilla extract. I have also substituted one cup of rolled oats for the flour and added chocolate chips (popular with my boys)

I've tried different recipes for banana bread, but this is the easiest and results in the most fluffiest, softest and best-tasting banana bread ever. It's also the most convenient because you don't need buttermilk. The only changes I made to the recipe were that I used butter instead of margarine, mashed 4 bananas instead of 3, added almond slices and spread white cream icing all over it after the bread cooled down. My son LOVED it!
I have used this for a few years and it never fails.

Too much flour and very bland. 
I tripled the recipe and used 4 cups of flour when it should’ve been 6 according to the recipe. I knew what banana bread consistency is and with 6 cups, it would’ve been far too thick and dry. If you’re just following the recipe I suggest 1 1/3 cups flour instead of 2. I also added vanilla, cinnamon, allspice, and cloves.
I loved this recipe, simple easy and delightful. By the evening there was only one slice left. Will definitely make again.
Delicious! Only added 1/2 tsp cinnamon
This recipe was moist, i also added chocolate chips I used four small loaf pans. I would definitely make this recipe again.

This is our favorite banana bread recipe! We follow it exactly and add the rind of an orange because we are citrus people. This banana bread is delicious for breakfast, a quick snack, or a healthy dessert. We love it in our house. Enjoy!!
It was delicious.
My husband loves this!
Wonderful I added 1/2 c walnuts , super easy recipe

I usually make my banana bread with sour cream but since I didn't have any I looked for another recipe. This bread was waaay too sweet and very dense. My recipe also has vanilla which adds depth to the flavour. We had a small piece each then tossed the rest which never happens in our house.

I made this last night. It was an easy, one bowl prep, banana bread recipe. I chose this one because of the large number of 5 star reviews. I sought out a new banana bread recipe because I was tired of my old oily recipe. I followed this recipe with minor changes purely for personal preference. I subbed the margarine out for a half cup of unsweetened apple sauce. I used half white & half brown sugar just because I was running low on white sugar. I added one tablespoon of Rum just out of curiosity because someone else tried it. I honestly didn't taste the rum in the final product. I also omitted the nuts. Overall it's a very nice fragrant, moist, dense, small crumb, banana bread and the recipe is quite forgiving. My husband thoroughly enjoyed it.

I started making the recipe because it seemed super simple, but while I was making it I realized the recipe seemed to be missing some key ingredients- cinnamon and vanilla, so I added a dash of both and then the batter seemed to be really dry so I added a bit of milk. After all that, it was pretty good.
By far the easiest and best base banana bread recipe I have ever used!!!! Thank you so much from someone who has always been “baking-challenged”??

didn't measure the bananas, just had four so that's what I put in. I also added some white chocolate chips. This was very moist and evenly cooked. A little sweet but that's probably the chips talking! I'd love to post a picture but I made it last night and it was gone by the time I got home at lunchtime today....
Prepared recipe exactly as directed & it was the best banana bread I've ever made!
I've made this twice in two days! The first time I did use half white and half brown sugar with no nuts. Tonight I added nuts. They were both excellent!
Delicious recipe! Easy to make! Made in loaves and muffins. Even gluten free flour works well with this recipe. We all love this recipe

The recipe is great as written but I often add chopped walnuts, 2 teaspoons of molasses, an extra banana and a few sprinkles of cinnamon. I usually make it into muffins. With that extra banana it'll yield 16 muffins with a nice high dome on top.

So my first attempt at making HOMEMADE banana bread and I used this recipe because I had just moved and hadn’t stocked my pantry yet (no vanilla extract). I was apprehensive in making it as it was for my mom and I usually used the box mix. MY MOM LOVED IT!!! She told me not to change a thing! I tasted it today at her house and it really turned out great! This will be my “go-to” banana bread recipe.

Yum! Best banana bread! I would recommend for anyone who wants an easy and super delicious bread. I only used a quarter of the sugar and I added another banana. I also added a few chocolate chips. A double batch made one large loaf and 2 mini loaves. I cooked the large one for about 45 mins and the small ones for 30. I have also made this recipe with no added sugar for my sugar-free friend and she loved it! Thank you so much for the recipe!
I added chocolate chips and chopped walnuts and it was so good. I also tripled the recipe and turned out great.

Love this recipe!! Always a bit hit when our bananas go bad. I also make muffins since my bread tends to be underdone in the middle and close to burnt on the top. My muffins tend to only take 25-30 minutes so I'd say just be careful depending on your oven.

It was wonderful first time baking banana bread. I added a bit of vanilla extract, small sachet of vanilla sugar too and mixed in chopped walnuts with chocolate chips and yellow raisins all decorated with pecans on top. Yum!
Best banana bread recipe I have tried. And very easy.
I have made this with both banana and apple sauce. Both came out realy good.

It was very good and hubby loved it. I did have to make one change though. I didn't have as much mashed bananas as the recipe called for (about 1/2 cup short) so I added 1/2 cup of applesauce to make up the difference. Was still very tasty.
Turned out great!
It was a little bland, could use more flavor but overall, I liked it
I added vanilla and walnuts.
Great recipe. I've made it several times and it's always a hit! I always add nuts though. Banana bread isn't banana bread without nuts!
excellent
This recipe works every time.
My go-to recipe for using ripe bananas. I add 1 tsp of cinnamon 3/4 cup chopped walnuts and cook for 70 min.
Easy to make--few ingredients--no nuts

Best banana bread ever! I used brown sugar instead of white and sprinkled a layer of nuts and browns sugar and cinnamon in the middle and on top! Top was crispy and crunchy and the bread was moist and sweet w little chunks of banana.
It’s simple to make and comes out delicious. I don’t adjust the recipe at all and it’s perfect every time!
Delicious, I also added chocolate chips.
I didn’t have baking powder which my usual recipe calls for so I tried this. Very good. My kids wanted to add chocolate chips and that was pretty yummy as well. I used butter rather than margarine.
Really liked it I added cinnamon and maple syrup for a little bit more taste
Second time making this. I have now added vanilla and walnuts to give ot a bit more flavour.
I made it and my whole family loved it.
Absolutely wonderful! It is the best..

I made this and added chocolate chips nd vanilla. Chips I should have left out as it was already sweet enough. I also did as a lot of others did and split the sugar amounts suggested (brown and white). Very tasty and moist. Loved it!
I added 1 tsp of vanilla, so delicious!!!

Adjusted the recipe to use 1/2 cup of brown sugar and 1/2 cup of white sugar as suggested by the other reviewers, otherwise kept everything the same. I found the bread wasn't very sweet and was very airy. More cake like than bread, but good. I will probably try adding 1tsp of vanilla next time and will adjust to use more brown sugar
This is a very good basic recipe. Mixes quickly. Bake is delightful. I like a little touch of spices and nuts in mine. This batter is the perfect batter to add what you wish.
I have been on a rampage trying different banana bread recipes and this is the best I've found. I made it exactly instructed except added 3/4 cup walnuts. Nice and moist and flavorful.
Very simple recipe and turned out very moist and delicious. I didn’t change anything on the recipe it was perfect
So Good, subbed different flours and nuts and all are soooo good. Easy to make and these ingredients are always around.

Good recipe. I modified it and did half white sugar, half brown sugar, added vanilla, subbed real butter, and added a pinch of salt. I baked for 1 hour. It tasted good. However, next time I'm going to add some cinnamon +/- nutmeg and walnuts so that it tastes more like what I'm accustomed to. It's a good starter recipe.
moist rich in flavor...

DELISH!!
I love that there is no oil added. 
I made it into two loaves for less baking time, was done in 35 min. So good

My go to base recipe. This time I added 1 tsp cinnamon & 1tsp vanilla extract. I also dusted the loaf pan with cinnamon & sugar. I had to make do with my ingredients on hand so I only put in 2 bananas & added a half cup of pine nuts. Making the best of this quarantine.
I normally don't like banana flavored stuff but I made it and it tasted amazing!
No I have not made any changes except I think it makes a difference if you use farm fresh eggs. Absolutely Delicious !

Love it 

I add -before oven- on topping :
- 1 table spoon butter 
- 1 table spoon all purpose flour 
-2 table spoon brown sugar 
-1 tea spoon cinnamon
New fave!!

I added Pecans for a little flare. 

Wonderful recipe!!
I'm not a baker, but I made this recipe and it turned out to be delicious and "professional" looking as well! If I can do this, anyone can!
Added Dark Chocolate chips to the batter and it came out great
Bland. Lesson learned
Very easy. I duplicated, split and added chocolate chips to half. Came out very good
Added a little vanilla turned out great and easy
yes i would make it again. used applesauce instead of margarine. added 1 tsp vanilla and 1 tsp cinnamon.
I added about a teaspoon of vanilla extract and then I topped it with crushed because which added a really nice crunch to it
The recipe is great! I added 1 cup of chopped walnuts and 1/2 cup of sour cream to make it extra moist! My husband loved it. I'm going to make my father a couple of loaves for Valentine's Day!
Couldn’t taste enough banana.
Couldn’t taste enough banana.
Added1/4 cup brown sugar along with 1 3/4 white sugar
Super easy to make, my family loves it! I’ve made four loaves so far and am planning on making more this week.
